field8: Note to country offices: adapt names used to describe sanitary pads by the girls in your context.
Note to community managers: please adapt the references to painkillers based on what types & brands would be available to girls in your country.
Note to community managers: please remove any of the listed hormonal birth control methods not available in your country.
Note to community managers: please change the examples of iron rich foods based on what is available in your country.
See information on Islam and menstruation (Cell E105)

Note for local country offices: You may wish to adapt this answer based on what is relevant in your context. Feel free to provide examples of any local customs or religious restrictions, including the justification for that restriction (as the question is 'why' this restriction is in place. But please emphasise that there is no medical reason behind this as we have done here. 

Feel free to refer to: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/70438/rulings-on-menstruation 
or : http://www.themodernreligion.com/women/w_menses.htm
